SENT.plain: Monozygotic twins discordant for the Wiedemann-Beckwith syndrome (WBS) were studied by cytogenetic and molecular methods to determine if a genetic lesion could be detected in the affected child
Probes known to be localized on the short arm of chromosome 11 and a low copy-repetitive probe were used
No genetic lesions could be ascertained in normal or affected tissue obtained from the WBS twin
